intro: Amanoa indica, commonly known as the Hawaiian moonflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, white flowers that bloom at night. The plant has simple, opposite leaves and produces small, red berries that contain the seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
